t: Proverbs 29
He*pn who is often reproved, yet stiffens his neck, will*ld suddenly be broken beyond healing.
When*ln the righteous increase, the people rejoice, but*ld when the wicked rule, the people groan.
He*ln who loves wisdom makes his father glad, but*ld a companion of prostitutes squanders his wealth.
By*ln justice a king builds up the land, but*ld he who exacts gifts tears it down.
A*ln man who flatters his neighbor spreads*ld a net for his feet.
An*ln evil man is ensnared in his transgression, but*ld a righteous man sings and rejoices.
A*ln righteous man knows the rights of the poor; a*ld wicked man does not understand such knowledge.
Scoffers*ln set a city aflame, but*ld the wise turn away wrath.
If*ln a wise man has an argument with a fool, the*ld fool only rages and laughs, and there is no quiet.
Bloodthirsty*ln men hate one who is blameless and*ld seek the life of the upright.
A*ln fool gives full vent to his spirit, but*ld a wise man quietly holds it back.
If*ln a ruler listens to falsehood, all*ld his officials will be wicked.
The*ln poor man and the oppressor meet together; the*ld Lord*s gives light to the eyes of both.
If*ln a king faithfully judges the poor, his*ld throne will be established forever.
The*ln rod and reproof give wisdom, but*ld a child left to himself brings shame to his mother.
When*ln the wicked increase, transgression increases, but*ld the righteous will look upon their downfall.
Discipline*ln your son, and he will give you rest; he*ld will give delight to your heart.
Where*ln there is no prophetic vision the people cast off restraint, but*ld blessed is he who keeps the law.
By*ln mere words a servant is not disciplined, for*ld though he understands, he will not respond.
Do*ln you see a man who is hasty in his words? There*ld is more hope for a fool than for him.
Whoever*ln pampers his servant from childhood will*ld in the end find him his heir.
A*ln man of wrath stirs up strife, and*ld one given to anger causes much transgression.
Oneâ€™s*ln pride will bring him low, but*ld he who is lowly in spirit will obtain honor.
The*ln partner of a thief hates his own life; he*ld hears the curse, but discloses nothing.
The*ln fear of man lays a snare, but*ld whoever trusts in the Lord*s is safe.
Many*ln seek the face of a ruler, but*ld it is from the Lord*s that a man gets justice.
An*ln unjust man is an abomination to the righteous, but*ld one whose way is straight is an abomination to the wicked.
